BUMN Sebut Sriwijaya Air Mundur dari Kerja Sama dengan Garuda
07 Nov 2019, 11:50 by Eko Wahyudi, Dewi Rina Cahyani
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Kerja sama PT Garuda Indonesia (Persero) Tbk. dengan Sriwijaya Air Group kembali terputus. Hal ini berdampak langsung terhadap operasional Sriwijaya Air, yang membuat sejumlah penumpang terlantar di Bandara Soekarno-Hatta.
Deputi Bidang Restrukturisasi dan Pengembangan Usaha Kementerian Badan Usaha Milik Negera (BUMN), Aloysius Kiik Ro mengatakan, keputusan tersebut bisa terjadi karena pihak Sriwijaya Air merasa sudah tidak ada kecocokan lagi dengan maskapai plat merah tersebut. "Dia (Sriwijaya) mundur duluan. Maksudnya enggak cocok antara kedua belah pihak," kata dia di Kompleks Parlemen, Senayan, Kamis, 7 November 2019.
Aloysius mengungkapkan, keputusan dari Sriwijaya untuk keluar dari perjanjian kerja sama itu telah disetujui oleh pihak Garuda Indonesia sendiri. Mungkin di aturan mainnya (penyebab cerainya 2 pihak ini), orang harus detail kan. Tapi kan yang confirm duluan sana kan, tapi ini disepakati," ucapnya.
Kisruh antara kedua perusahaan, menurut dia, belum dilaporkan ke Kementerian BUMN. Namun menurutnya, hal itu tidak jadi masalah karena urusan ini telah menjadi business to business (BtoB).
Sebelumnya, Direktur Teknik dan Layanan Garuda Iwan Joeniarto menyatakan PT Sriwijaya Air (Sriwijaya) dan anak usaha Garuda Indonesia, PT Citilink Indonesia tidak akur, dan saat ini maskapai Sriwijaya tidak lagi menjadi anggota Garuda Indonesia Group dan akan kembali berdasarkan business to business (B to B).
"Kami merujuk pada status terkini kerja sama manajemen antara Sriwijaya Air dan Citilink, anak usaha Garuda Indonesia. Karena ada sejumlah masalah di mana kedua pihak belum bisa diselesaikan. Dengan berat hati, kami menginformasikan bahwa Sriwijaya melanjutkan bisnisnya sendiri,‚Äù kata Iwan dalam keterangannya yang beredar di Jakarta, Kamis, 7 November 2019.
EKO WAHYUDI | ANTARA

SOEs Call Sriwijaya Air Withdrawing from Cooperation with Garuda
Nov 7 2019, 11:50 by Eko Wahyudi, Dewi Rina Cahyani
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Cooperation of PT Garuda Indonesia (Persero) Tbk. with Sriwijaya Air Group cut off again. This has a direct impact on Sriwijaya Air's operations, which has displaced a number of passengers at Soekarno-Hatta Airport.
Deputy for Business Restructuring and Development of the Ministry of State-Owned Enterprises (SOEs), Aloysius Kiik Ro said, the decision could occur because Sriwijaya Air felt that there was no longer a match with the red plate airline. "He (Sriwijaya) resigned first. It means that it does not fit between the two parties," he said at the Parliament Complex, Senayan, Thursday, November 7, 2019.
Aloysius said that the decision of Sriwijaya to leave the cooperation agreement had been approved by Garuda Indonesia itself. Maybe in the rules of the game (the cause of the 2 parties' divorce), people have to be detailed right. But the one who confirmed there was first right, but this was agreed upon, "he said.
Chaos between the two companies, according to him, has not been reported to the Ministry of SOEs. But according to him, it was not a problem because this matter had become business to business (BTOB).
Previously, Garuda's Technical and Service Director Iwan Joeniarto stated that PT Sriwijaya Air (Sriwijaya) and Garuda Indonesia's subsidiary, PT Citilink Indonesia did not get along, and currently the Sriwijaya airline is no longer a member of the Garuda Indonesia Group and will return based on business to business (B to B).
"We refer to the current status of management cooperation between Sriwijaya Air and Citilink, a subsidiary of Garuda Indonesia. Because there are a number of problems where the two parties have yet to be resolved. We are reluctantly informed that Sriwijaya continues its own business," Iwan said in his statement. circulating in Jakarta, Thursday, November 7, 2019.
EKO WAHYUDI | AMONG
